databasepackage

Class MPT

  • java.lang.Object
    • databasepackage.MPT

  • public class MPT
extends Object
    Provides a set of tools that can be used to simplify the implementation of Muti-Processing Systems
    Author:
    Saud Fatayerji

      MPT()

      • MPT

        public MPT()

    • Method Detail

      • getLR

        public static int[] getLR(int proc,
                          int nprocs,
                          int maxI)
        Gets the range of elements to assign to an individual processor/thread.
        Parameters:
        proc - The index of the current processor
        nprocs - The number of processors available.
        maxI - Number of elements to partition.
        Returns:
        An array of the left (inclusive) and right (exclusive) indexes respectively.

      • lr2Range

        public static int[] lr2Range(int[] lr)
        Converts the left and right indexes into an array of consecutive values in the range of the values provided.
        Parameters:
        lr - The LR array as returned by getLR()
        Returns:
        an array with values in the range of the LR values

      • lr2Range

        public static int[] lr2Range(int left,
                             int right)
        Converts the left and right indexes into an array of consecutive values in the range of the values provided.
        Parameters:
        left - The starting value in the range (inclusive)
        right - The end value in the range (exclusive)
        Returns:
        an array with values in the range of the LR values

      • split

        public static <T> ArrayList<T>[] split(int nprocs,
                                       ArrayList<T> list)
        Evenly distributes the values provided in the ArrayList into nprocs ArrayLists.
        Parameters:
        nprocs - The number of processors for which to split the list.
        list - The list of values which should be split.
        Returns:
        An array of ArrayLists containing all the values that should be processed by the respective processor.

      • split

        public static <K,V> HashMap<K,V>[] split(int nprocs,
                                         HashMap<K,V> map)
        Evenly distributes the values provided in the HashMap into nprocs HashMaps.
        Parameters:
        nprocs - The number of processors for which to split the list.
        map - The map of values who's contents will be split.
        Returns:
        An array of HashMaps containing all the key-value pairs that should be processed by the respective processor.
